definition: fashionable/popular
wind/news/style/custom/manner/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],絲|丝[si1]
to waste (money)
extravagant/go with fashion/not
fashionable for a while (idiom); all the rage

sentences.english: Remember that number puzzle craze a couple of years back?
sentences.chinese: 还记得风靡一时的数字拼图游戏吗？

sentences.english: The inspiration originates from the Apple experience centers which are popular all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 这个灵感来自于风靡全球的苹果体验店。

sentences.english: These \"upside down\" trees were all the rage last year.
sentences.chinese: 这些是去年风靡一时的“倒立”圣诞树。

sentences.english: With the court, chocolate moves in by via the blue Danube.
sentences.chinese: 随着宫廷的迁移，巧克力也风靡了蓝色多瑙河。

sentences.english: The show became enormously popular, not only in the United States but worldwide.
sentences.chinese: 这部电视剧不仅在美国非常受欢迎，而且风靡世界。

sentences.english: Police Incompetence and Corruptness a World Wide Epidemic.
sentences.chinese: 无能的警察，全球风靡的腐败现象。

sentences.english: The flamenco craze began to spread all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 佛拉曼科舞迅速风靡全世界。

sentences.english: They hope it will be a hit, but will it?
sentences.chinese: 他们希望这间店会风靡一时，但它会吗？

sentences.english: Dachas and weekend cottages will be popular.
sentences.chinese: 郊外别墅和周末小别墅将会风靡。

sentences.english: The vinegar-drinking trend gained momentum in 2004, when black vinegar became all the rage.
sentences.chinese: 2004年黑醋风靡一时之际，饮醋风潮开始盛行。

sentences.english: Second special edition " special west Fan " and then sweep the pop circle.
sentences.chinese: 紧接着的第二张专辑《范特西》又风靡流行音乐界。

sentences.english: As a kind of internationally-recognized nourishment, collagen has been popular throughout the world for decades.
sentences.chinese: 作为国际公认的营养品，胶原蛋白已风靡世界数十年。

sentences.english: Penholder due to ease of use, quickly swept the world, is still not bad-sheng.
sentences.chinese: 笔筒因使用方便，很快就风靡天下，至今仍盛而不衰。

sentences.english: The number but section is all the rage the world the number anagram topic game.
sentences.chinese: 数独是一款风靡世界的数字谜题游戏。

sentences.english: Black leather trousers seem to be quite the rage these days.
sentences.chinese: 近来黑色皮裤似乎风靡一时。

sentences.english: Lego is one of the most popular toy in the world.
sentences.chinese: 乐高是世界上最风靡的玩具之一。

definition: fashionable for a while (idiom); all the rage
to be popular for a while/to be all the rage for a time
tremendously popular for a while
north and south sides of the Yangtze River (idiom)/(fig.) all over China
(of a contagious disease etc) to spread/to propagate/(of a style of clothing, song etc) popular/fashionable
tempest/wave (of popular sentiment etc)/craze or fad
to be in vogue/to be prevalent
unfailing/never-ending
to be popular/to be in luck/to have good luck/to develop smoothly
the earliest ancestor/originator (of a tradition, school of thought etc)
to rise/to spring up/to burgeon/to be aroused/to come into vogue
upsurge/popular craze
to sell strongly/to be in great demand
to be a big hit/to be hugely popular
popular/well-received
understood by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
